description:
The match statement is a new feature of the Python language, defined in
PEP-634 and will be standard in the upcoming Python 3.10 (due out in
October 2021).

Adding syntax for new language features introduces both new
possibilities and sources for confusion. Let's stay ahead of the game by
learning what to expect from the match statement by playing with the
alpha version of Python (available now).

This talk will compare the match statement to similar constructs in
other languages, demonstrate some typical use cases, briefly discuss
Python's implementation, and propose some best practices when solving
problems with the match statement.
title: An Exploration of Python's Upcoming Match Statement
